Description: Come hang out with UCBoulder at Bolder Climbing Community! 7-10 pm every second Saturday night, starting January 18!

Melanight is a night to celebrate excellence and unite people to enjoy music, performances, food, and culture, all for Black History Month. Attendees can expect an extravagant evening in their best formal or cultural clothes filled with African and Caribbean culture. This gala-style event will include keynote speakers, singers, dinner, prizes, and much more!
Taking Strides Climbing sessions provide a space for kids and teens with disabilities to learn to climb in a safe, supportive and social environment.

Event Name: Taking Strides Recreational (Adaptive Sports and Teen) Sessions
Description: Taking Strides is a weekly, adaptive recreational program where kids with disabilities engage in specialized activities that build upon physical literacy skills.

Location: Firmitas B in the Vitruvian Space in the Dining Centre
Description: This is a Christian worship service for all the University of Calgary community including students, staff, faculty members, and other community members. Everyone is welcomed to worship the Lord God together.
This will be a time of spiritual retreat. This will be a great opportunity to experience community and to learn about spiritual practices and rhythms that will help students continue the semester.

Event Name: Taking Strides Recreational (Rhythm and Strength) Sessions
Description: Taking Strides Rhythm & Strength is a weekly, adaptive dryland program aiming to improve flexibility, strength, and rhythm through various movement-based activities. Kids will work one-on-one with an assigned volunteer, led by a sessional instructor guiding participants through various structured activities.
Come and join us at The Banquet Bar for a lovely round of Bowling, Food and Beverage, and games!

Schulich Ignite's Spark Game Jam is the culmination of our programming courses, where jammers showcase their skills by creating games in a short amount of time. It's a platform to practice time management, planning, and teamwork, while also providing a fun and unwinding experience. Participants ideally have beginner coding knowledge.
